com.highsoft.highcharts.Common.HIChartsClasses

Class HIAccessibility

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.highsoft.highcharts.Common.HIChartsClasses.HIAccessibility
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    HIChartsJSONSerializable

    public class HIAccessibility
extends java.lang.Object
implements HIChartsJSONSerializable
    description: Options for configuring accessibility for the chart. Requires the //code.highcharts.com/modules/accessibility. js : accessibility module to be loaded. For a description of the module and information on its features, see http://www.highcharts. com/docs/chart-concepts/accessibility : Highcharts Accessibility.

      description: Enable accessibility features for the chart.

      description: Options for keyboard navigation.
      HIGFunction onTableAnchorClick
      description: Function to run upon clicking the "View as Data Table" link in the screen reader region.

      description: Date format to use for points on datetime axes when describing them to screen reader users.

      description: Formatter function to determine the date/time format used with points on datetime axes when describing them to screen reader users.

      description: When a series contains more points than this, we no longer expose information about individual points to screen readers.

    • Field Detail

      • screenReaderSectionFormatter

        public HIGFunction screenReaderSectionFormatter
        description: A formatter function to create the HTML contents of the hidden screen reader information region. Receives one argument, chart, referring to the chart object. Should return a String with the HTML content of the region. The link to view the chart as a data table will be added automatically after the custom HTML content. default: undefined

      • pointDescriptionThreshold

        public java.lang.Double pointDescriptionThreshold
        description: When a series contains more points than this, we no longer expose information about individual points to screen readers. Set to false to disable. default: 30

      • pointDateFormat

        public java.lang.String pointDateFormat
        description: Date format to use for points on datetime axes when describing them to screen reader users. Defaults to the same format as in tooltip. For an overview of the replacement codes, see dateFormat.

      • keyboardNavigation

        public HIKeyboardNavigation keyboardNavigation
        description: Options for keyboard navigation.

      • pointDateFormatter

        public HIGFunction pointDateFormatter
        description: Formatter function to determine the date/time format used with points on datetime axes when describing them to screen reader users. Receives one argument, point, referring to the point to describe. Should return a date format string compatible with dateFormat.

      • pointDescriptionFormatter

        public HIGFunction pointDescriptionFormatter
        description: Formatter function to use instead of the default for point descriptions. Receives one argument, point, referring to the point to describe. Should return a String with the description of the point for a screen reader user.

      • enabled

        public java.lang.Boolean enabled
        description: Enable accessibility features for the chart. default: true

      • seriesDescriptionFormatter

        public HIGFunction seriesDescriptionFormatter
        description: Formatter function to use instead of the default for series descriptions. Receives one argument, series, referring to the series to describe. Should return a String with the description of the series for a screen reader user.

      • describeSingleSeries

        public java.lang.Boolean describeSingleSeries
        description: Whether or not to add series descriptions to charts with a single series. default: false

      • onTableAnchorClick

        public HIGFunction onTableAnchorClick
        description: Function to run upon clicking the "View as Data Table" link in the screen reader region. By default Highcharts will insert and set focus to a data table representation of the chart.

    • Constructor Detail

        public HIAccessibility()
